Encephalic death is the definitive and irreversible destruction of the brain.

It corresponds to a deep, reactive coma, with disappearance of all brain stem reflexes and absence of spontaneous breathing.

question.title: What is the definition of encephalic death?
question.description: A medical term describing the loss of brain function

option_a.title: Brain death
option_a.description: A condition where the brain is no longer functional

option_b.title: Vegetative state
option_b.description: A state of partial brain function, but no awareness or responsiveness

option_c.title: Coma
option_c.description: A state of deep unconsciousness, but not necessarily brain death

option_d.title: Anoxic brain injury
option_d.description: Damage to the brain caused by lack of oxygen
